output_list.reason: The mintToken function has an integer overflow that allows the owner to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value.

The transferFrom function uses the `allowance` mapping, which is initialized with random values. This means that the `allowance` mapping contains arbitrary values, and therefore the `transferFrom` function has a potential security vulnerability.
The mintToken function has an integer overflow that allows the owner to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value.
The freezeAccount function has an integer overflow that allows the owner to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value.
